channel.title: Aphrodite #357 Framework - Apache mina - Login Only!
channel.description:
[ul][CENTER][font=impact][size=5]Aphrodite #357 Framework:[/size][/font] Aphrodite #357 is a framework wrote by myself; this framework has a [mina implementation([url=http://mina.apache.org/]Apache MINA - Welcome to Apache MINA Project![/url]) A few friends of mine on msn have asked me "why 357". The reason for this is because i've always liked my uniquie revisions, and as I have been createing an old school server I thought that 357 is quite an appropriate revision for an 'old school remake'. (As it's between 317 and 377. A combination of old maps and new items.)
[font=impact][size=5]Features:[/font] [list] [*] An apache mina implementation. ([url=http://mina.apache.org/]Apache MINA - Welcome to Apache MINA Project![/url]) [*] A client to server packet handling system. [*] Graham's implementation of the ISAACCipher. (Original created by Bob Jenkins - [url=http://www.burtleburtle.net/bob/java/rand/Rand.java]http://www.burtleburtle.net/bob/java/rand/Rand.java[/url]) [*] The rsa has been disabled. in order to re-enable it, search for modpow and uncomment it. [*] Login. [/list] [font=impact][size=5]Media:[/font] [list] [*] Packageing: [IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/wikjl3.jpg[/img] [/list] [list] [*] Login: [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/rtf6ew.jpg[/img] [/list] [font=impact][size=5]Downloads:[/font] let this die please it was low grade cow poo Client - [url=http://www.multiupload.com/SYRXQJ3SYT]Multiupload.com - upload your files to multiple file hosting sites![/url]
[font=impact][size=5]Credits:[/font] [list] [*] Karl. (For the actual framework) [*] The Apache mina development team. (For the networking liabries) [*] Graham. (For his implementation of the ISAACCipher) [*] Bob Jenkins. (For the original ISAACCipher - [url=http://www.burtleburtle.net/bob/java/rand/Rand.java]http://www.burtleburtle.net/bob/java/rand/Rand.java[/url]) [*] Jagex. (For the runescape client) [*] The RS #357 development team (For refractoring and releaseing a 357 client) [/list] Notice: I'm still working on this I just thought I would release what I have so far.[/CENTER][/ul]

item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=460507.msg3539482#msg3539482 date=1300755587]
lol’d

Luckily I didn’t do much with the name, should be as simple as a quick refactor

Oh and his is just a networking API
[/quote]oh, i didn’t read it, lol.
i just remembered seeing ‘blakeman1492’ and ‘helios’ on a topic somewhere, so i searched and saw that.

:P[/quote]

I was going to use helios in my server before I quit because I am a fag like that.

item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

[ul][CENTER][font=impact][size=5]Aphrodite #357 Framework:[/size][/font]
Aphrodite #357 is a framework wrote by myself; this framework has a [mina implementation(Apache MINA - Welcome to Apache MINA Project!)
A few friends of mine on msn have asked me “why 357”. The reason for this is because i’ve always liked my uniquie revisions, and as I have been createing an old school server I thought that 357 is quite an appropriate revision for an ‘old school remake’. (As it’s between 317 and 377. A combination of old maps and new items.)

[font=impact][size=5]Features:[/font]
[list]
[] An apache mina implementation. (Apache MINA - Welcome to Apache MINA Project!)
[] A client to server packet handling system.
[] Graham’s implementation of the ISAACCipher. (Original created by Bob Jenkins - http://www.burtleburtle.net/bob/java/rand/Rand.java)
[] The rsa has been disabled. in order to re-enable it, search for modpow and uncomment it.
[] Login.
[/list]
[font=impact][size=5]Media:[/font]
[list]
[] Packageing:

[/list]
[list]
[*] Login:

rtf6ew.jpg777×528

[/list]
[font=impact][size=5]Downloads:[/font]
let this die please it was low grade cow poo
Client - Multiupload.com - upload your files to multiple file hosting sites!

[font=impact][size=5]Credits:[/font]
[list]
[] Karl. (For the actual framework)
[] The Apache mina development team. (For the networking liabries)
[] Graham. (For his implementation of the ISAACCipher)
[] Bob Jenkins. (For the original ISAACCipher - http://www.burtleburtle.net/bob/java/rand/Rand.java)
[] Jagex. (For the runescape client)
[] The RS #357 development team (For refractoring and releaseing a 357 client)
[/list]
Notice: I’m still working on this I just thought I would release what I have so far.[/CENTER][/ul]
